text: <@U021RA7HR34> unfortunately pages created with the starter template do not have advanced settings options.

hello
My company is new to HubSpot. I cannot find where the code for the `Website pages` are. I see the template code in `Design Tools` but not the page code. I tried downloading this locally using the `hs` cli, but I still don't see the pages.
Can someone tell me the location? I've been researching for hours.
So when you are in the template (using templates not a theme) the code is located in the module. Just left click and view source code will get you what you are looking for.
If you are asking about the whole page at once I'm not sure if there is a way inside HubSpot itself.
I've moved to themes where this editor doesn't even exist anymore it is just page source code and modules and Visual Studio Coded friendly.
I'm liking the sound of that. Can you point me to a guide/doc of how to set it up that way?
Or if you happen to find one, let me know. not trying to give you homework right before the weekend :slightly_smiling_face:
You can get them in the store.
I personally used their template and built my own. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-themes>
I build (raw) modules in visual code then upload it to HS where I then replace the code with custom fields for the functionality that I want built in.
